column5: Hey Guys,  Headed out for the opener this morning and despite the weather forecast, the rain actually held off for most of the morning. The walleye were hitting but not on fire, my grandpa and I caught 7 total, with 4 of them being keepers. Overall decent opener but no monsters an not a lot of fish but definately way better then getting skunked. Tons of boats on the water and despite the boat traffic the walleye were active chasing down our jerkbaits. Hope all the other guys on the water also had some luck for the opener!
Fishing with Grampa... that's a perfect day right there! Then you caught fish....

That's wonderful.... a great opening for you. Being with your Grandpa just makes it a hundred times better. Thank your blessings and cherish the memories because many of us never had that chance. But it sounds as though you already know that.  Congrats to you, great pics too!
I got skunked on the grand.  Nice eyes.
Great looking fish!! That's a good start to the season
Good for you guys Some decent Eyes, and a day with Gramps. How do you top that
Nice job, always fun fishing with family!
Well done.  Very fine fish.
nice eyes congrats
Good for you. I got skunked on the North end of Chemong this morning. I was surprised to have the lake completely to myself.
Ohhhhhhh boy I've got the itch now.  Beautiful fish
Good report! Obviously you were on Balsam judging by the size of those "keepers".
Nice fish! Definitly not balsam. I've seen you fishing there a couple of openers now though. Good spot.  S.
Just thinking that for FMZ 17 walleye have to be between 35-50 cm (13.8-19.7 in.)to be kept except Balsam.

I'd say he only took pics of the bigger ones. 7 caught, 4 kept. Pics of 3 nice ones. I know the spot for sure, and I'm sure there are a few others on here that know the spot too. Its no secret.........anymore  S.
Fishing with grandpa, gotta love it!  Some really good looking eyes, too
Awesome dude!  I was close with my grandpa and he died when I was only 5.... Missed him every day since... Enjoy the times out with him!!!!! Good work!
yah seen you out there man nice fish, i must say this was a good year tho we got tons of eyes lots of nice size to
what a great way to spend time with your grandpa!  Awesome!  Cheers!
I grew up fishing with my Grandpa. He landed my pb walley (almost 9lbs.) with is hands has we had forgot the net. He is 97 now and not doing so well. Nice healthy looking eyes.

Great Report. There really ins't anything like fishing with your grandpa. My grandfather taught me most of what I know and I am still fortunate enough to  fish with him. I plan on doing plenty of perch days with him this summer.  Chris
